drawnet.lib.filters
Class GSPNFilter

java.lang.Object
  drawnet.lib.filters.Filter
      drawnet.lib.filters.GSPNFilter

public class GSPNFilter
extends Filter

The Filter allows to export a model in the format used by GSPN.

Data are stored in a FilterDataGSPN object.

The model can have 7 types of element:

  • rate parameter
  • mark parameter
  • place
  • transition
  • arc
  • inhibitor arc
  • result

Remarks

Associations between tag names and formalism properties (fdl) are set in "gspn_config.xml" following the grammar defined in "gspn_config.dtd".

The type of the "mark" property in places must be VariantPropertyType. Possible values:

  • IntegerPropertyValue: a integer value
  • PropertyRefPropertyValue: a reference to "val" property of a "mark parameter" element

The type of the "rate" property in transitions must be VariantPropertyType. Possible values:

  • FloatPropertyValue: a floating point value
  • PropertyRefPropertyValue: a reference to "val" property of a "rate parameter" element
  • StringPropertyValue: a string containing the parameter definition

The model name is set as the remark in the GSPN .net file.

Layers and colours are not managed.

See Also:
FilterDataGSPN

public java.lang.String writeDEFToString(Model m,
                                         boolean rebuild)
Writes a model definition into a String in GSPN format (.def).

Parameters:
m - the model to write
rebuild - if true, rebuild support structures. It is useful for optimization purposes: when .net has already been written, there is no need to build structures again (so 'false' should be passed)
Returns:
a String containing the model in GSPN format

getTransThruProperty

public java.lang.String getTransThruProperty(ElementInstance element)
Returns the name of the transition throughput property. This is defined in "gspn_config.xml" and depends on the passed element (there are different types of transitions).

Returns:
the name of the throughput property
